event.title: the end of the year, United Way officials said

data.event: ATLANTA - Regional 2-1-1, a dialing code linking needy Georgia residents with everything from food pantries to social services, could begin expanding statewide by the end of the year, United Way officials said.
Little Jr., president of United Way of Metropolitan Atlanta, which initiated the exchange in 1997 and is leading efforts to expand statewide.
Right now, 2-1-1 callers are connected with operators at one of 11 call centers serving metropolitan regions across the state.
Operators fielded more than 370,000 calls in 2008, up from more than 336,000 in 2007.
Little said some calls this time last year were for post-tornado help in the region.
